name: United States (Federal)
description: Federal employment and contract law baseline

at_will_doctrine.description: Employment can be terminated by either party at any time, for any reason (with exceptions)
at_will_doctrine.note: Montana is the only state without at-will doctrine

exempt.duties_test: Executive, Administrative, Professional, Computer, Outside Sales

protected_classes: Sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity)

written_required_for: Contracts that cannot be performed within one year

contract_requirements.capacity: Parties must be 18+ and mentally competent

key_federal_laws.name: Family and Medical Leave Act
key_federal_laws.description: 12 weeks unpaid leave for qualifying reasons

key_federal_laws.name: National Labor Relations Act
key_federal_laws.description: Right to organize and collective bargaining

non_compete_rules.general_rule: Enforceable if reasonable in scope, duration, and geography
non_compete_rules.note: FTC proposed ban on non-competes (pending as of 2024)

state_variations_note: Individual states may have stricter requirements. Check state-specific knowledge files.
